Pros:
-You feel great if you manage to outplay a toxic player.

Cons:
-There are a Lot of toxic players and you're not always great.
-Each update brings one or two game breaking bugs.
-The gameplay isn't balanced
-Devs took Years to add in a colorblind setting and that was only after a dev talked sh*t on stream about people asking for colorblind settings.

Every match is unique and will definitely give you a thrill whether you're playing survivor or killer.
Much less toxic than any other online game simply because there's no in-game chat!! You still get some scums trying to tea-bag you but if you can ignore that, you're in for pure fun.

Uninstalling was the best decision I ever made! devs don't pay attention to fixing actual issues and pander to 'loot box' style of updates where its nothing but pay to win killers and pay for cosmetics among other garbage. the community is both toxic and completely filled with mentally ill drag queens and queer lovers. The only thing I enjoyed was wiping out an entire survivor with friends group of lgbt people with a mori. it was so satisfying otherwise this game is a 2/10

This game makes you question wether or not other human beings could actually act this irrational. Truly an expansion of mind.
Jokes aside, this game is a ton of fun because of how many different playstyles you can go for based on the perks you run. The grind in this game is also very extensive, even after 200 hours I feel like I could grind for another 1000 at least.
